""I just held it tight without trying to cut off the blood too much, because you have to be careful with that, I guess," Shannon added"
#####
Exactly right. I was taught to loosen the tourniquet intermittently so as to keep blood flowing to the limb. Not only did he save a life, but possibly the leg.

replies.context: Current TQ protocols say do NOT loosen at all. If anything - check to make sure it has not come loose. As high as possible on the limb and as tight as possible. It will hurt but it will save their life. Sadly this protocol was developed based on 1000s of battlefield injuries during the last 20 years. I suspect this guy made to a trauma center w/in the Golden Hour. They can deal with the TQ there.

Army combat medic here. Absolutely incorrect. A person has four hours with a tourniquet and maybe four minutes without one. Infection or complication doesn't set in immediately. Stopping the bleeding and calling 911 needs to be your focus. Let infection and compartment syndrome be EMS and the doctor's worry.

Quick thinking by this guy saved the life. Let the doctors save the rest.
Also a combat medic and 100% correct. Dont worry about a tourniquet being too tight people. Life over limb.

2 already beat me too it but sorry you are incorrect. Life over limb. Get that F‚Äôr tight and secure, put pressure on the wound (if possible) and elevate the extremity. You dont have to be a combat medic like myself to know proper first aid.
Thanks guys! Good to know.

context: When I first got transferred to Tampa, I was warned that any body of water in the state, you should assume has alligators.   Some are calm and some are hungry.  We had big bull alligators who would sun themselves on the greens of our golf course and you just played through as they left you alone.   Then again people who walk their dog should not get too close to water as they can be swallowed by a gator quickly.   You have to respect them as they were here before we were.  We had one neighbor who left their pool cage door open and came home to a baby alligator in their pool.   A bunch of old men stupidly removed the small gator themselves instead of calling animal control people.

replies.context: Those old men had probably dealt with more than one little gator in their lives...

I don't agree with your comment "You have to respect them as they were here before we were", you respect them because they are a dangerous predator.  I could care less if they were here before us, it is time to eliminate a large amount of these (from residential areas) as they are a threat to people and pets.  You wouldn't let a pack of wolves jackals run around your neighborhood IMHO.
